author: calzonie
title: Cute Little Train!
review:
The Winter Holiday Train is a perfect little build for its size and just feels nice to look at, which I think is all you can ask from something like this. The locomotive has a great color scheme and as much detail as you could possibly fit at this scale. The other two cars are a lot less intricate, but they fit the holiday theme and their simplicity would make it easy to extend the train with custom builds. I'm not sure if this was an intentional detail, but I like how the green car has enough storage space to fit the extra parts when you're done. I don't think this train would fit on any LEGO railroad pieces, which is the only real downside. I'd like to see some mini rails eventually, to compliment this 4-wide scale.

It's hard to judge the value of a Gift With Purchase, but with a buying requirement of $40 USD, it's still on the lower end. Compared to the other current Holiday GWP, 40565 Santa's Workshop, the Winter Holiday Train is much more affordable and arguably a better set overall.

author: Adameus
title: Cute little winter build
review:
The build looks very nice, it would definitely compliment the winter village builds. Colour scheme is on point, I don't like the use of 4x4 plates in white (black or brown would look better in my opinion).

The part selection is good, could certainly help any MOC. 2x2 jumper plate in gold is probably the best part in this set.

The playability is minimal, the wheels spin nicely, and you can swap the carts around. You could also combine it with the locomotive from 11021 90 Years of Play, as they're both part of the Micro Train System.

The value for the money is certainly here. I think the price is fair, but I've heard that it is only distributed as a GWP in certain regions.

Overall rating: 7/10
